title: ArianeGroup Receives Rear Heat Shield Mock-Up for ExoMars Mission
summary:
French tooling manufacturer Loiretech has delivered a second component of a mock-up of the ExoMars heat shield to ArianeGroup’s facilities in Saint-Médard-en-Jalles. The development of the European Space Agency’s (ESA) revised ExoMars mission, which will deliver the Rosalind Franklin rover to the surface of the Red Planet, is being led by Thales Alenia Space under […]

title: NASA Software Raises Bar for Aircraft Icing Research
summary: When flying in certain weather conditions, tiny freezing water droplets floating in the air can pose a risk to aircraft. If not taken into consideration, these water droplets can accumulate on an aircraft as ice and pose a safety risk.  But NASA software tools such as Glenn Icing Computational Environment (GlennICE) are working to keep […]

title: NASA Completes Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope Construction
summary: NASA’s next big eye on the cosmos is now fully assembled. title: Comet 3I/ATLAS shows activity in Juice navigation camera teaser
Orion hatch ‘blemish’ delays launch day rehearsal for Artemis 2 astronauts
summary: The temporary issue caused the agency to reorient its planned order of pre-rollout tests within the Vehicle Assembly Building. The agency continues to target an early February launch of the mission.

title: The shift that saved American spaceflight
summary:
In this episode, former NASA commercial space division chief Phil McAlister sits down with host David Ariosto for a wide-ranging conversation about the future of human spaceflight, NASA’s internal culture, and the explosive growth of the commercial space sector.

summary:

title: ICEYE boosts SAR capacity with launch of five satellites for commercial and national missions
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Nov 28, 2025


ICEYE has placed five new Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) satellites into orbit, extending its commercial constellation and adding spacecraft for several national customers. The satellites rode to space on SpaceX's Transporter-15 rideshare mission launched on November 26, 2025, from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, after integration by Exolaunch.
